subCats.name: Gate Valve DIN F4
subCats.head_1: Gate Valve with Rubber-Coated Wedge per DIN F4
subCats.paragraph_1: The SG45R-16D series gate valve is engineered for high performance and durability, featuring a rubber-coated wedge that enhances sealing and reduces friction. With a wide range of nominal diameters (DN 50-1000) and a pressure rating of PN 16, this valve is suitable for various industrial applications. The temperature range of -25°C to +130°C ensures versatility in different operational conditions. Constructed from ductile iron (GJS), both the valve body and the wedge offer robust resistance to wear and corrosion. The wedge is coated with EPDM for improved sealing and longevity. This valve conforms to Class A standards as per GOST 54808-2011, ensuring reliable operation and quality assurance. Designed to meet DIN F4 specifications, this gate valve provides dependable performance and ease of maintenance, making it an excellent choice for managing flow in demanding environments.
subCats.typesHeader: Gate Valve with Rubber-Coated Wedge per DIN F4

types.type: Wedge Material: Ductile Iron (GJS) coated with EPDM

subCats.name: Rubber-Coated Gate Valve
subCats.head_1: Gate Valve with Rubber-Coated Wedge and Double Stem Gland
subCats.paragraph_1: The SG45R-16DP series gate valve is designed for high-performance and durability in demanding environments. This valve features a double stem gland for enhanced sealing and protection against leakage, making it suitable for applications requiring a high level of reliability. The valve is equipped with a rubber-coated wedge, which provides superior sealing and reduces friction, ensuring smooth operation.
subCats.typesHeader: Gate Valve with Rubber-Coated Wedge and Double Stem Gland

types.type: Wedge Material: Ductile Iron (GJS) coated with EPDM

subCats.name: Rubber-Coated Gate Valve (Underground)
subCats.paragraph_1: The SG45R-16DU series gate valve is engineered for underground applications, delivering robust and reliable performance under challenging conditions. Featuring a rubber-coated wedge for excellent sealing and reduced friction, this valve operates smoothly and efficiently. It is suitable for a broad range of flow requirements, available in nominal diameters from DN 50 to DN 1000 with a pressure rating of PN 16. The valve is versatile across a temperature range of -25°C to +130°C, with its ductile iron (GJS) body and wedge providing strong resistance to corrosion. The EPDM-coated wedge enhances sealing capabilities and extends the valve's lifespan. Compliant with Class A standards as per GOST 54808-2011, the SG45R-16DU ensures high-quality, reliable operation, making it an ideal choice for secure fluid control in critical infrastructure and industrial applications.

types.type: Wedge Material: Ductile Iron (GJS) coated with EPDM

subCats.name: Rubber-Coated Gate Valve (Light)
subCats.paragraph_1: The SG45R-16DL series gate valve is crafted for applications that benefit from a lighter construction, providing reliable performance with ease of installation and handling. Featuring a rubber-coated wedge for excellent sealing and smooth operation, it handles nominal diameters from DN 50 to DN 600 with a pressure rating of PN 16. Operating effectively in temperatures from -10°C to +120°C, the valve's body and wedge are made from ductile iron (GJS), offering robust strength and corrosion resistance. The EPDM coating on the wedge enhances sealing and extends the valve's lifespan. Compliant with Class A standards according to GOST 54808-2011, the SG45R-16DL valve delivers dependable operation, making it ideal for less demanding industrial and infrastructure applications where a lighter option is preferred, with a design that emphasizes performance and ease of maintenance.

types.type: Wedge Material: Ductile Iron (GJS) coated with EPDM

subCats.name: Butterfly Valve
subCats.paragraph_1: The SB71R-16D series wafer-type butterfly valve is designed for versatile applications, offering reliable flow control across various industries. It features a durable disc made from ductile iron (GJS), available with nickel plating or in stainless steel, ensuring excellent corrosion resistance and longevity. The valve body, also constructed from ductile iron (GJS), provides robust performance under diverse conditions. With nominal diameters ranging from DN 40 to DN 1200 and a pressure rating of PN 10-16, the valve efficiently operates within a temperature range of -25°C to +120°C. It offers multiple sealing options, including EPDM, NBR, VITON, and PTFE, to suit different media and application needs. Compliant with Class A standards according to GOST 54808-2011, the SB71R-16D valve guarantees high-quality, reliable operation. It is designed for easy integration with various actuators, adhering to the ISO 5211 standard, and is suitable for both manual and automated systems, making it an ideal choice for industries requiring precise and dependable flow control solutions.

types.type: Disc Material: Ductile Iron (GJS) with Nickel Plating, Stainless Steel
Seal Options: EPDM, NBR, VITON, PTFE

subCats.name: Butterfly Valve Eco
subCats.paragraph_1: The SB71R-16E series Eco wafer-type butterfly valve offers a cost-effective and efficient solution for flow control across diverse industries. With a cast iron body and a disc available in cast iron with a protective coating or stainless steel, it delivers reliable performance and durability. Supporting nominal diameters from DN 40 to DN 1200 and a pressure rating of PN 10-16, this valve is versatile for various applications. It operates within a temperature range of -10°C to +100°C and provides multiple sealing options, including EPDM, NBR, and VITON, to suit different media and requirements. Compliant with Class A standards per GOST 54808-2011, it ensures high-quality, dependable operation. Designed for easy integration with actuators according to ISO 5211, the SB71R-16E is ideal for both manual and automated systems, offering a practical and economical choice for reliable flow control solutions.

types.type: Disc Material: Cast Iron with Coating, Stainless Steel

It features a sturdy construction with a body made from either ductile iron (GJS) or stainless steel, and a disc made from ductile iron with nickel plating or stainless steel, providing excellent durability and resistance to corrosion. subCats.name: Wafer-Type Slide Gate Valve
subCats.paragraph_1: The SG73R-10D series wafer-type slide gate valve is designed for reliable and efficient flow control in a variety of industrial applications. It features a robust body made from ductile iron (GJS) and a durable blade crafted from stainless steel 08X18H10, offering excellent corrosion resistance and strength. This valve supports nominal diameters ranging from DN 50 to DN 1200 and operates within a pressure range of PN 10-16. It is effective across a temperature range of -25°C to +130°C and provides sealing options with EPDM or NBR to accommodate different media and operational needs. The bidirectional flow capability enhances its versatility, making it suitable for applications requiring dependable control in both directions. Compliant with Class A standards according to GOST 54808-2011, the SG73R-10D ensures high-quality, dependable performance.

subCats.name: Double-Eccentric Butterfly Valve

Compliant with Class A standards according to GOST 54808-2011, this valve ensures high-quality, dependable performance, making it a robust choice for various flow control applications.

subItems.name: CLUMPING DRUM
subItems.title: Efficient and Reliable Clumping Drum Solutions
subItems.description: With our EMP model, which has been developed according to the principle of minimum energy consumption, we put an end to energy losses in belt pulleys with reducer-driven photocells. EMP® Staior design comes with holes that can be measured as a 6Ge connected to the heat exchanger. The hole design allows for smaller air bubbles to form, which provides better bonding with finer ore particles in the cleaning and cleaning circuits. Optionally, in the cable flotation circuit, these holes can be closed with polyurethane caps and larger air bubbles can be formed.

subItems.name: CONDITIONERS
subItems.title: IMEC Advanced Conditioners: Optimal Performance and Efficiency Solutions
subItems.description: A conditioning tank plays a crucial role in the flotation process by ensuring thorough mixing of chemical reagents with the ore, which is essential for the proper adhesion of surfactants like collectors, frothers, and modifiers to mineral surfaces. It ensures uniform mixing of ore and reagents, leading to consistent material composition for efficient flotation. The tank also provides necessary interaction time for effective reagent adsorption on minerals and helps adjust pH and ionic strength, optimizing the chemical environment for the flotation process. These functions significantly impact overall efficiency and performance.
subItems.typesHeader: High-Performance Conditioner System for Flotation Processes

subItems.name: FLOATATION CELLS
subItems.title: IMEC Flotation Cells: Cutting-Edge Technology for Optimal Mineral Recovery
subItems.description: With our EMPR model, developed with the principle of minimum energy consumption, we eliminate energy losses caused by belt pulleys in reducer-driven flotation cells. The EMP® Stator design comes with optional perforated holes. This hole design allows for the creation of smaller air bubbles, which provides a better contact angle with finer ore particles in sweeping and cleaning circuits. Optionally, in the coarse flotation circuit, these holes can be covered with bolted polyurethane caps to create larger air bubbles.
subItems.typesHeader: Exterior View of IMEC Flotation Cell

subItems.name: FOAM PUMP
subItems.title: IMEC Foam Pump: Efficient Solutions for Foam Management
subItems.description: The IMEC Foam Pump is engineered to deliver superior performance in managing and transporting foam within industrial processes. Designed with advanced technology, this pump efficiently handles foam with minimal energy consumption and optimal reliability. Its robust construction ensures durability and longevity, even under demanding conditions. The IMEC Foam Pump is ideal for applications where precise foam control is crucial, providing consistent flow rates and reducing operational costs. With its innovative design, the IMEC Foam Pump enhances overall process efficiency, making it a valuable addition to any industrial setup requiring effective foam management.

subItems.name: TICKENER
subItems.title: IMEC Tickener: Advanced Solution for Efficient Solid Settling
subItems.description: Deep Mineral Process designs tikiners to reduce flocculant consumption and ensure the required solid settling. The key feature of our tikiner design is to cut off all the energy of the pulp in the feed box and transfer it to the feedwell by its own gravity. To achieve the desired water purity, dilution is performed in the feedwell, and the flow is directed into the tank to allow solid particles to fall freely from the static blades to the tank cone under gravitational acceleration.

subItems.name: SLURRY PUMPS
subItems.title: High-Efficiency Slurry Pumps for Robust Material Handling
subItems.description: We manufacture five types of horizontal heavy-duty pumps, namely DMP MD 10.8, DMP MD 8.6, DMP MD 6.4, DMP MD 4.3, and DMP MD 3.2. These pumps are designed to withstand harsh, abrasive environments and are available with high-chrome or rubber linings, and can be equipped with either expeller or wet systems.
subItems.typesHeader: IMEC Slurry Pump Wet System

subItems.name: SLURRY DENSITY METER
subItems.title: Slurry Density Meter: Precision Measurement for Optimal Process Control
subItems.description: The Rhosonics SDM stands for Slurry Density Meter, which is a category of instruments that allows for measuring the density of slurries in real-time. This instrument uses a non-intrusive ultrasonic sensor to measure the real-time density of mineral slurries under high-density levels and at very large pipes. Moreover, the SDMs have a robust design with sensors made of highly abrasion-resistant materials, making them ideal for rough process conditions. Rhosonics helps mineral processing plants and other industries to replace nuclear density gauges by non-hazardous ultrasonic technology. Consequently, operators can achieve process optimization in a safer, more reliable, sustainable, and cost-effective way. This is how Rhosonics contributes to a greener and smarter industry. On November 2nd,2023, Rhosonics released the latest version of the SDM, the SDM ECO. The SDM ECO is an upgrade of the SDM-4 in terms of accuracy, response time, operating temperature range, and sensor design. In addition to that, the SDM ECO can be controlled by a 7’’ touchscreen display, laptop, via optional Wi-Fi, or from anywhere with server access.
subItems.typesHeader: Slurry Density Meter Flow Measurement Point

subItems.name: CHEMICAL DENSITY METER
subItems.title: High-Accuracy Chemical Density Meter for Industrial Applications
subItems.description: Rhosonics CDM stands for Chemical-based slurry Density Meter, which is a category of instruments that allows for real-time density measurement. The CDMs have a robust design that uses sensors made of highly corrosion and abrasion-resistant materials, enabling them to withstand rough process conditions.In various industries, the Chemical Density Meters are used whenever there is a requirement for measuring chemical-based slurries or liquors. Some of the sectors where this technology is used are Mining, Ore refineries and Pulp & Paper.
subItems.typesHeader: Chemical Density Meter Sensor and Probe Close-Up

subItems.name: CHEMICAL CONCENTRATION METER
subItems.title: High-Performance Chemical Concentration Meter for Reliable Monitoring
subItems.description: Numerous industries use chemical concentrations in their production processes because accurate and reliable measurement is important for process optimization. Therefore, Rhosonics has developed several CCM models that can withstand harsh process conditions and are resistant to a wide range of chemicals.Overall, the Rhosonics Chemical Concentration Meter is a valuable tool for industries that require accurate and reliable measurement of chemical concentration. Its ease of use, accuracy, and efficiency make it an ideal choice for a variety of applications.
subItems.typesDescription: Some of the industries that can benefit from this technology include:

types.type: Copper Foil plants for measuring H2SO4 & Cu++ concentrations.
Zinc refineries for measuring H2SO4 & Zn concentrations.
Breweries’ wastewater treatment plants (WWTPs) for measuring chemical concentrations in the wastewater. In addition, the CCMs are capable of measuring the COD concentration of sugar-based wastewater.
Flat Panel Display manufacturing plants for measuring complex chemical mixtures such as TMAH+PR+(CO3).

subItems.name: Particle Size Analyzer
subItems.title: PSA – Particle Size Analyzer
subItems.description: The PSA provides real-time process monitoring in wet streams. Analyzing dozens of pictures per minute it literally looks into the process slurry. Its advanced software provides the Particle Size, images and more; with results displayed directly in the site’s control system.

subItems.name: Jaw Crushers
subItems.title: Versatile Jaw Crushers for Primary and Secondary Crushing
subItems.description: Jaw crushers are engineered to crush stones of all hardness levels, making them versatile machines suitable for a variety of applications. They can serve as both primary crushers, handling large rocks at the initial stage of crushing, and as secondary crushers, further reducing the size of materials after primary crushing. The crushing process in jaw crushers involves applying high pressure, which efficiently breaks down the material due to the machine's working principle.
subItems.typesHeader: Primary Jaw Crushers:

categories.categoryDescription: These jaw crushers are designed for primary crushing applications, capable of handling large rocks and providing initial size reduction. They are built to withstand high pressures and heavy loads.

Secondary jaw crushers are used for secondary crushing stages, further reducing the size of materials after primary crushing. They are designed to handle smaller feed sizes and finer output specifications.

subItems.name: Vibration Analyzer
subItems.title: Advanced Vibration Analyzer for Predictive Maintenance and Diagnostics
subItems.description: A vibration analyzer is a specialized device used to measure and analyze vibrations in machinery and equipment. It helps in detecting imbalances, misalignments, and other issues in mechanical systems by capturing vibration signals and processing them to determine the frequency and amplitude of the vibrations. The data collected by a vibration analyzer can be used for predictive maintenance, allowing maintenance teams to identify potential problems before they lead to equipment failure. This tool is essential in various industries, including manufacturing, power generation, and automotive, where it aids in ensuring machinery operates efficiently and with minimal downtime.
subItems.typesHeader: Vibration Analyzers:

subCats.name: NEST i4.0
subCats.title: NEST i4.0
subCats.description: NEST is a predictive maintenance software that helps you plan maintenance actions by monitoring the condition of rotating equipment. A user-friendly interface has been designed, from creating a database to the reporting step. Key features include automatic machine tree setup, guided analysis, and easy access to autonomous reports. Data collected from wireless sensors and processed through AI systems like Accurex™ make it easier and faster to generate predictive maintenance reports. Thanks to its flexible software architecture, it allows viewing multiple factories on a single cloud interface.
subCats.head_3: Complete Support for Your Analysis Process
subCats.paragraph_1: The NEST i4.0 software provides clear and autonomous dashboards and reports for all employees involved in the maintenance and management processes of rotating equipment. Easily understandable visuals that summarize the entire situation offer information about asset condition to both staff with no vibration analysis knowledge and the most skilled vibration analysts. Reports can be accessed instantly from anywhere in the world through a regular internet connection.
subCats.paragraph_2: One of the most laborious and tedious tasks in the predictive maintenance process is creating machine trees for rotating equipment. However, with the autonomous machine tree creation feature offered by NEST i4.0, this process becomes much faster and error-free. All you need to do is use the 'drag and drop' tool to create machine directories and define kinematic information (such as motor power, RPM, etc.). Then, NEST i4.0 will automatically generate measurement tasks based on this information. With this configuration, you can use the Accurex™ automatic analysis tool without errors. Even if you have no vibration data, all the necessary measurement routes for your critical equipment will be ready for use in minutes.
subCats.paragraph_3: NEST i4.0 is the most efficient vibration analysis software available on the market. In addition to all traditional analysis tools, users are guided to precise points in their analyses through innovative tools such as the Health Matrix screen, Bearing Defect Factor™, Shock Finder™ for low-speed equipment, HarmoniX™ index, and the Accurex™ AI engine. The Analyst module also features advanced analysis tools such as combined spectrum screens, circular time signals, patent-pending bode ellipses, waterfall charts, and orbit charts. This allows everyone from the least experienced users to the most skilled vibration analysts to access necessary machine health information from a single software.
subCats.paragraph_4: In today's world, making data-driven decisions is crucial for increasing the reliability and profitability of facilities. The NEST i4.0 software, with its ability to integrate with cloud systems, allows you to monitor data from factories located in different parts of the world and our country from a centralized software. Additionally, with the NEST Dashboard interface, all assets can be remotely monitored through a single interface using data from one or more remote locations and various data sources such as Falcon, Eagle, or MVX. Fully compliant with new IT requirements for cybersecurity, NEST Dashboard is ideal for central monitoring architecture and can be easily accessed from phones, tablets, and computers with any internet connection.

subCats.name: Falcon
subCats.title: FALCON: Advanced Vibration Data Collection and Analysis Device
subCats.description: FALCON is a high-end vibration data collection and analysis device. It can be configured according to your needs with various optional modules to perform tasks such as on-site balancing, acceleration/deceleration, frequency analysis, modal testing/ODS, and more.
subCats.head_1: All Necessary Features in One Device
paragraph_1: Instant Results with AI-powered Accurex Algorithm: Provides immediate insights into machine condition and potential failures on-site.
Touchscreen and User-Friendly Interface: Easy to operate with intuitive controls.
Three-Axis Wireless Sensor: Allows synchronized, fast, and secure measurements from all directions.
Fast Vibration Measurement and Analysis: Measuring each bearing takes an average of 8 seconds with the three-axis sensor!
Four Different Options with Upgradable Models: Choose from Essential, Smart, Expert, and Ultimate, with the ability to upgrade later.
Built-in Stroboscope: Measures and records machine RPM.
Built-in Laser Pyrometer: Measures bearing temperatures.
Built-in Camera: Reads barcodes for quick and easy location of measurement points and takes photos for your reports.
Synchronous 4-Channel Sampling: 102.4 kHz sampling frequency and 80 seconds of measurement time.
ATEX Zone II Certified Version: Available for ex-proof areas.
subCats.paragraph_2: The FALCON device offers instant benefits of predictive maintenance with its Accurex™ automatic diagnostic module, delivering results from the very first measurement. As soon as faults are detected, they are immediately presented to the user, providing guidance for additional tests like bearing lubrication and temperature checks, ensuring a more reliable diagnosis. Based on ISO 10816 standards and ACOEM's over 30 years of experience, this module provides dependable results. Whether your facility has hundreds of critical pieces of equipment or just a few, Accurex helps you quickly assess the overall condition and identify equipment needing closer analysis. Detected faults are presented with their location and a confidence interval (patent pending), offering comprehensive and precise insights.
subCats.paragraph_3: FALCON makes it easy for everyone. Your database is quickly and automatically created under your supervision, leaving you to simply take measurements and take maintenance actions based on the results. The measurement configuration and database creation process are seamlessly handled by the user-friendly NEST i4.0 desktop software. You simply enter the machine's tag information, and the software takes care of the rest swiftly and automatically. What used to be tedious is now as easy as child's play. All vibration measurements, including ISO 10816 velocity RMS value, acceleration RMS value, Bearing Defect Factor™, high-resolution FFT, time waveform, and custom parameters, can be added with just a few clicks across the entire database. Creating a database has never been this easy!
subCats.paragraph_4: With the wireless three-axis sensor and real-time data processing capabilities, vibration measurement times are significantly reduced. It takes just 8 seconds to obtain high-quality vibration data from the X, Y, and Z directions. The use of facility and machine photos makes locating machines on a route easier than ever. The measurement technician can navigate step-by-step from an overhead view of the facility to the sensor location on the machine using FALCON's large, colorful touchscreen. Alternatively, the technician can quickly correlate the measurement point with the route using the barcode reading system.
subCats.paragraph_5: FALCON is designed for industrial use in the toughest environments. It boasts an ATEX Zone 2 certification, IP 65 protection, and can withstand drops from up to 1.2 meters. The device features a large, colorful touchscreen that can be operated even with work gloves, and comes with a rubber case for easier handling and added protection against impacts. Its wireless sensor allows users to operate safely within a range of 10 to 20 meters between the sensor and the device. Measurements can be taken behind protective covers or doors, making it easy to conduct assessments in hot and hazardous environments.

subCats.name: EAGLE
subCats.title: Remote Wireless Monitoring with EAGLE: Up to 150 Three-Axis Vibration Sensors
subCats.description: The EAGLE system allows you to monitor machines in remote, confined, or hazardous locations without laying cables by pairing up to 150 wireless three-axis vibration sensors with a single gateway router.
subCats.head_1: All the Features You Need in One Place
subCats.head_3: Ideal Solution for Your Critical Equipment
paragraph_1: Three-axis vibration and temperature measurement with a single sensor
Reduces installation costs by eliminating the need for cables
±50 g dynamic range, measurement of spectrum, time signal, and envelope spectrum in all directions up to 20 kHz
Does not interfere with other wireless networks
Can be used with all rotating equipment starting from 100 RPM
Suitable for environments with explosion risks due to its EX Proof feature
Allows for measurement under special operating parameters (speed, load, etc.) by communicating with a PLC
Ideal for monitoring machines in enclosed, hazardous, or hard-to-reach areas
Easy maintenance: battery lasts five years under normal operating conditions and is easily replaceable
subCats.paragraph_2: It is now possible to enhance the reliability of inaccessible, moving, or protected machines in your facility and improve installation reliability in challenging environments or remote locations. EAGLE is a fully automated wireless sensor. The wireless gateway can be installed up to 100 meters away from the sensor, and the coverage area can be extended using wireless extenders. The transmission of vibration data to the analysis software is done wirelessly with high reliability. EAGLE installation is quick and easy.
subCats.paragraph_3: EAGLE is the best-performing wireless system in the vibration analysis market. Its measurement quality makes it suitable for monitoring all machines that rotate faster than 100 RPM. EAGLE is not just a sensor; this intelligent wireless system can process signals: advanced indicators, as well as the envelope spectrum, are calculated within the system, allowing for the recording of measurements when a vibration or bearing temperature alarm occurs. The data storage frequency is automatically adjusted based on the machine's condition. Data can be transmitted to the NEST i4.0 machine health platform, which offers unique and patented methods like the Shock Finder™ filter, and can be used for detailed analysis. You can plan your maintenance activities well in advance of any potential failures.
subCats.paragraph_4: EAGLE is optimized for long-term service with high performance and low maintenance costs. The EAGLE battery offers up to 5 years of usability under nominal operating conditions, with one full measurement set per day, without the need for external power supply or maintenance operations. For critical machines, EAGLE can provide an optimal monitoring strategy with frequent alarm monitoring and high-quality data storage (total value, time waveform, FFT, envelope), offering a 2-year lifespan even under these conditions. Additionally, the inexpensive standard battery can be easily replaced on-site by the end user.
subCats.paragraph_5: The EAGLE solution is designed to meet industry requirements. Both the EAGLE sensor and extenders are approved for use in explosive Zone 0 (Class I, Div I) environments. The stainless steel body, with very low thermal expansion, ensures safe use even in the harshest environments. With IP67 protection, EAGLE is also resistant to corrosive environments. Being wireless and automatic, EAGLE can be used where wired online systems are not feasible, allowing you to monitor your equipment without the need for portable devices.

subCats.name: mvx-mv-120
subCats.title: MVX & MV-120: Advanced Real-Time Condition Monitoring for Critical Rotating Equipment
subCats.description: ACOEM online condition monitoring systems are designed for continuous, multi-channel condition monitoring of critical rotating equipment. Real-time automatic analysis of vibration data helps prevent unexpected downtimes caused by faults. Machine condition is continuously and reliably monitored, allowing for early detection of failures and enhancing plant reliability.
paragraph_1: Real-Time Condition Monitoring System
Configurable Channel Count: 12 to 32 channels
Shock Finder™ Technology: Enables fault detection on very slow rotating shafts
Management of Multiple Operating Conditions: Defined by one or more process parameters
Integration with Other ACOEM Devices: Data collected by other ACOEM devices (Falcon or Eagle) can be integrated with data collected by MVX in the NEST interface
Compatibility with Existing Protection Systems
Seamless Data Collection: Continuous condition monitoring with no gaps, ensuring no events are missed
Always on Guard: MVX detects even the slightest abnormalities in real time
Pre-Trigger Function: Includes data from before the occurrence of an event by incorporating raw signal measurements
Detection of Transient and Non-Repeating Events: Helps in identifying transient issues and avoiding false alarms
subCats.paragraph_2: In the era of Industry 4.0, capturing data is straightforward, but reliably analyzing it under variable process conditions is crucial for predicting failures. MVX and MV-120 technology excels in monitoring even the most complex machines in today’s industrial processes. It allows the definition of up to 10 different operating conditions using one or more process parameters, automatically applying data collection strategies, indicators, and alarm thresholds for each condition. With built-in stability parameters, you can be confident that measurements are taken at the optimal moment, ensuring precise and actionable insights.
subCats.paragraph_3: Predictive maintenance for low-speed rotating machines is more complex due to the need for high-resolution data and advanced vibration analysis tools, which can challenge many systems and analysts. ACOEM provides an excellent solution for monitoring low-speed equipment with its MVX and MV-120 systems, integrated with NEST software. This technology enables simultaneous recording of data from several shaft rotations of low-speed equipment (<10 RPM) across 32 channels, facilitating the detection of bearing faults through analysis of both low and high-frequency content. The ACOEM Shock Finder™ algorithm, developed through practical applications, enhances the detection of shock vibrations hidden within low-frequency, high-amplitude signals, making it easier to identify bearing damage in low-speed equipment.
subCats.paragraph_4: MVX and MV-120 encompass a variety of communication protocols and hardware. They feature two manageable Ethernet ports, allowing separate network connections for NEST software and PLC, with one port used for software communication and the other for PLC interaction. The systems support bidirectional Modbus TCP/IP or Modbus RTU (RS485) for two-way data exchange with PLC and SCADA systems. They offer 4 or 8 alarm outputs or digital inputs, which can be used to activate warning systems or stop machinery, and manage measurements. An OPC Server enables publishing of alarm statuses and expert recommendations through NEST software, while email notifications can be sent to predefined addresses for alarm conditions. Additionally, MVX and MV-120 are compatible with Wi-Fi, 3G-4G, and wired Ethernet communications, with unsent data stored in internal memory to prevent data loss.

subCats.name: BEARİNG DEFENDER
subCats.title: BEARING DEFENDER: Wireless 3-Axis Accelerometer for Rapid Bearing Health Assessment
subCats.description: The Bearing Defender is a wireless three-axis accelerometer that quickly provides insights into the health of your bearings. Its user-friendly design allows for rapid, first-level bearing health assessments to be performed by personnel at all levels. This enables vibration analysts to focus on critical equipment while using this easily portable wireless sensor to collect data with your smartphone or tablet.
subCats.head_4: 30 Years of Expertise in Your Sensor
subCats.paragraph_1: The Bearing Defender is designed to make bearing condition assessment accessible to every technician. With a simple selection of machine speed range, power range, and mounting type, the Bearing Defender informs users of potential bearing failures, imbalances, misalignment issues, or other problems. Its visual icon-based interface and color-coded alerts allow any user to operate the Bearing Defender effectively without prior training.
subCats.paragraph_2: The Bearing Defender captures, processes, and displays data in just 10 seconds, offering a comprehensive assessment of bearing health. It provides insights into vibration levels, including alarm thresholds based on the ISO10816-3 standard, high-frequency acceleration, displacement, and Bearing Defect Factor™. Additionally, it visualizes vibration spectra across three axes using ZYXTRUM™, ensuring a thorough evaluation with intelligent indicators.
subCats.paragraph_3: For detecting common damage in rotating machines, such as imbalance or structural resonance, single-axis measurements may not be sufficient. Bearing Defender facilitates the measurement process by capturing three-axis vibration data in a single pass, ensuring that no faults in your machine are overlooked. With its patented wireless measurements, Bearing Defender provides a quick and reliable way to enhance the reliability of your equipment.
subCats.paragraph_4: Bearing Defender, compatible with wireless and mobile devices, incorporates the Acoem Bearing Defect Factor™ algorithm, developed through testing over 2,000 bearings since the 1970s. This proven technology is widely used across various industries for monitoring bearing failures in commonly used machinery. The system alerts you to bearing damage, imbalance, and misalignment issues, and, with the Machine Defender app, provides comprehensive insights into the overall condition of the machine rather than just point-based data, using Accurex™ technology.
subCats.paragraph_5: Bearing Defender is compatible with iOS and Android smartphones and tablets, allowing you to seamlessly integrate vibration measurements into your Maintenance 4.0 program using a standard and user-friendly display device. With Wi-Fi connectivity and mobile apps, you can capture photos of measurement points with your device’s camera and share measurement results with experts via screenshots, maximizing the efficiency and effectiveness of your field personnel.

subItems.name: Alignment Devices
subItems.title: Precision Alignment Devices: Simplifying Shaft Alignment
subItems.description: Precision alignment devices, like the Fixturlaser NXA Pro, streamline both standard and complex shaft alignment tasks. These advanced tools not only handle conventional horizontal and vertical alignments but also tackle unconventional applications with efficiency. Featuring intuitive user interfaces with universal colors and easily understandable symbols, these devices enable users to perform accurate alignments quickly and effortlessly, saving valuable time and reducing labor.
subItems.typesHeader: Alignment devices:

subCats.name: Fixturlaser NXA Pro
subCats.title: Fixturlaser NXA Pro: Advanced Shaft Alignment Made Easy
subCats.description: The Fixturlaser NXA Pro enhances efficiency by handling standard horizontal and vertical shaft alignment tasks, as well as more complex alignment applications, with ease. Its intuitive user interface, featuring universal colors and clear symbols, allows users to execute alignment procedures effectively, ensuring accuracy while saving both time and effort.
subCats.head_1: What Sets the NXA Pro Apart
subCats.paragraph_1: The NXA Pro stands out with its advanced features that address common alignment challenges. Its interactive 3D visualization, driven by gyroscopes in the screen unit, adjusts the display according to the user's position, reducing potential confusion during the process. The device ensures reliable shaft alignment by considering the impact of nearby machinery vibrations through repeatability testing. Additionally, it allows for the determination of thermal expansion values not provided by machine manufacturers, facilitating accurate alignment calculations and reducing the user's workload. The sequential machine feature enables the alignment of sequentially arranged equipment shafts with a single measurement, predicting and applying desired solutions without additional equipment. For H-type intermediate shaft couplings, it separately detects angular misalignments at both ends, enabling prompt application of corrective procedures. Furthermore, the NXA Pro simplifies alignment for universal joint connections with its dedicated software and additional fixture, making it highly effective and user-friendly for various alignment applications.

subCats.name: FIXTURLASER EXO
subCats.title: FIXTURLASER EXO: Certified Smart Alignment System for Hazardous Areas
subCats.description: The FIXTURLASER EXO is a cutting-edge alignment system specifically engineered for use in hazardous environments, offering robust and precise performance. It features advanced technologies such as True Live, which provides continuous real-time updates of machine positioning, and VertiZontal Moves™, allowing for simultaneous alignment adjustments in both horizontal and vertical axes without the need for repeated measurements. The system's EX-certified smart sensors and integrated Bluetooth ensure reliable wireless communication and accurate readings, even in challenging conditions. With its user-friendly, icon-based interface and color-coded displays, the FIXTURLASER EXO simplifies complex alignment tasks, reduces the risk of operator error, and accelerates setup time. This system not only enhances alignment accuracy but also contributes to significant time and cost savings across maintenance and production operations.
subCats.head_1: Certified Smart Alignment System for Hazardous Areas
subCats.paragraph_1: The FIXTURLASER EXO offers a certified, smart alignment solution designed for hazardous environments, integrating industry-leading features like GuideU, Alignment Intelligence, True Live, and VertiZontal Moves™. These advanced laser-based shaft alignment tools deliver unparalleled ease of use, precision, and cost savings. The True Live feature provides real-time machine positioning updates, ensuring accuracy even if the laser beam is interrupted. The EXO system uses industry-leading EX-certified smart sensors and integrated Bluetooth for seamless wireless communication. With a digital sensor detector and line laser, it eliminates rough alignment and shortens setup times. It also features an internal dual inclinometer for detecting gaps and measuring angular values during horizontal alignment. The intuitive, icon-based, color-coded user interface reduces operator error and simplifies the alignment process, making it accessible for users of all experience levels. VertiZontal Moves™ enables precise adjustments in both horizontal and vertical axes with a single measurement, saving time and ensuring accuracy, which translates to significant cost savings for maintenance and production departments.

subCats.name: RT-300
subCats.title: Shaft Alignment
subCats.description: Robust Sensor Design: Featuring an IP65-certified sensor design, the system is built to withstand challenging environments. The 30 mm digital sensor detector combined with a line laser eliminates the need for rough alignment and ensures a quick setup process. Pre-mounted fixtures and compact sensors enable rapid installation even in confined spaces.
subCats.paragraph_1: The system utilizes industry-first technologies, including visible laser beams from dual smart sensors and tilt meters that simultaneously monitor both shaft positions. This advanced technology ensures precise measurements without guesswork. If the laser beam is interrupted or the machine moves out of the detector's range, the smart sensors continue to provide real-time updates with the most current machine position, guaranteeing continuous and accurate alignment data.
subCats.paragraph_2: The Run-Out Probe is an advanced displacement sensor designed for precise and reliable measurement of axial and radial run-out. This high-precision, wireless probe features an LVDT sensor with a measurement range of ±2.5 mm and accuracy within 0.005 mm. It performs a range of critical applications to enhance machine health and longevity, including measuring eccentric or misaligned coupling hubs, checking for bent shafts, and controlling axial and radial run-out on flanges and shafts. It also includes industry-first functions like True SoftCheck for assessing soft foot conditions directly on machine feet, LiftCheck for bearing clearance checks, and monitoring movements due to pipe tension and thermal growth in machine housings.
subCats.paragraph_3: Machine Defender features the unique Accurex™ automatic machine identification system, providing unparalleled speed, relevance, and reliability in diagnosing a wide range of machine issues, including imbalance, alignment errors, cavitation, structural resonances, and bearing problems. Its patented machine identification capability sets it apart from all other systems, leveraging the innovative Accurex™ software to detect faults with greater accuracy and reliability than any previous automatic diagnostic tools.
subCats.paragraph_4: Acoem leverages digitalization and mobility to enhance traditional industries, making them smarter. To achieve this, data explaining machine conditions must be collected and centralized. This involves connecting measurement results and other information from the RT-300 to Acoem Cloud, which serves as a central hub. This connectivity fosters a new form of collaboration among people, and between people and machines. Technicians on-site can securely share real-time data with remote supervisors and stakeholders worldwide, with information always just a click away. Updates, maintenance notifications, field data, and asset configurations can be shared instantly.

subCats.name: AT 200
subCats.title: Smart Maintenance for Smart Shaft Alignment
subCats.description: Integrated with connectivity, mobile devices, and applications, the AT-200 becomes a rapid tool for addressing machine failures and corrective actions. Smart sensors utilize CCD technology for superior measurement performance and precise alignment.
paragraph_1: 30 mm Digital Sensor Detectors: Capable of measuring long distances and large angular misalignments.
Integrated Line Laser: Eliminates the need for rough alignment with a quick setup.
Thin Smart Sensors: Among the thinnest available, suitable for tight spaces.
Internal Dual Inclinometer: Detects coupling gaps and obtains angular values during horizontal alignment.
Integrated Bluetooth: Facilitates wireless communication between the display unit and smart sensors.
Digital Signal Processing: Less sensitive to ambient light, with improved point rejection and edge detection.
Sunlight-Resistant Detectors: Designed to perform reliably under sunlight.
Instant Battery Check: Available in both open and closed modes.
IP65 Certified: Durable for harsh environments.
Pre-Mounted Support Rods: Ensures quick installation in confined spaces.
subCats.paragraph_2: The AT-200 stands out as a smart, application-based alignment tool with its patented GuideU adaptive user interface. Leveraging industry-first visible laser beams and inclinometer technology that tracks both shaft positions simultaneously, it eliminates guesswork. Even if the laser beam is interrupted or sensor connections are lost, the intelligent sensors will continue to provide up-to-date machine positioning and accurate real-time values.

subCats.name: Fixturlaser NXA Ultimate
subCats.title: NXA Ultimate: The Pinnacle of Measurement Tools
subCats.description: The NXA Ultimate stands out as a premier measurement tool, expertly designed to handle both geometric and shaft alignment applications. This versatile instrument ensures optimal operational conditions by first verifying the flatness of machine foundations and then precisely aligning the machinery post-installation. By addressing both pre-installation and operational alignment, the NXA Ultimate guarantees that your machinery performs at its best.
paragraph_1: Ultra-High Resolution CCD Detectors: Provides unparalleled measurement accuracy.
Bluetooth-Enabled Compact Sensor Units: Integrates 30 mm detector surfaces and line lasers for compact yet effective measurements.
OmniView™ Technology: Utilizes built-in gyroscopes to display screen data from the user’s perspective, tracking both the user and machine positions.
Advanced Sensor Position Tracking: Allows alignment in both vertical and horizontal orientations, even without 180° shaft rotation.
Exceptional Power Management: Delivers up to 10 hours of operation on a single charge.
Graphical User Interface: Features intuitive icons and color-coded symbols with 3D animations for clear guidance through measurements.
Micron-Resolution Measurements: Ensures high precision and minimal corrections.
Post-Measurement Evaluation: Processes recorded results to select the optimal reference.
Lifetime Warranty: Backed by a limited lifetime warranty for additional reliability.
subCats.paragraph_2: By incorporating these advanced features, the NXA Ultimate offers an exceptional solution for both routine maintenance and new installations, ensuring precision and efficiency in every measurement.

subCats.name: Fixturlaser EVO
subCats.title: EVO Laser Shaft Alignment System
subCats.description: Meeting today’s demands for multi-disciplinary and efficient technicians, the EVO stands out with its compact size and ease of use. Designed to deliver high efficiency with minimal labor, EVO's compact design ensures effective alignment solutions even in confined spaces, providing precise results with reduced physical intervention.
subCats.head_1: Laser Shaft Alignment: Compact Solutions for Modern Needs
subCats.head_4: VertiZontal Moves – Measure Once, Adjust Twice!
subCats.paragraph_1: In today’s world, mechanical technicians are expected to handle increased workloads and be proficient across various disciplines. To meet these needs, more tasks must be accomplished with less manpower. The EVO, with its compact size and user-friendly design, perfectly fits these requirements. It offers an ideal solution for those seeking precise alignment results with minimal physical intervention.
subCats.paragraph_2: EVO is all about advanced simplicity—without the frills and bling. It stays true to our core values: simplicity, user-friendliness, and innovative techniques. Featuring a 5” color touchscreen, the compact display unit is both slim and balanced, allowing you to hold it with one hand while keeping the other free to interact with the screen icons and adjust the shafts. With a clean and color-coded graphical user interface, EVO assists maintenance professionals throughout the measurement and alignment process, eliminating complexity and stress.
subCats.paragraph_3: EVO sensors feature a 30 mm CCD detector, ensuring exceptional precision alignment and unique repeatability regardless of ambient light and measurement conditions. An additional advantage is the compact size of the sensors, measuring only 33 mm in thickness, allowing them to easily fit into even the tightest spaces.
subCats.paragraph_4: The VertiZontal™ Moves feature precisely indicates how much adjustment is needed for a misaligned machine by adding or removing shims at the machine's feet. This eliminates the need for re-measurement between vertical and horizontal phases when correcting horizontal misalignment. As an industry first, this function saves time and guarantees accuracy on the first try.

subCats.name: Fixturlaser ECO
subCats.title: Fully Digital Wireless ECO: Dedicated to Horizontal Shaft Alignment
subCats.description: The ECO is a fully digital wireless entry-level system dedicated to horizontal shaft alignment. Its compact display unit, equipped with a 4” color screen, ensures easy use in confined spaces. The intuitive user interface provides industry-leading ease of use. Combined with wireless sensors and an IP 65 certified design, the ECO offers a cost-effective precision device specifically designed for horizontal shaft alignment.
subCats.head_3: VertiZontal Moves: Measure Once, Move Twice!
subCats.paragraph_1: The ECO’s compact display unit features a 4” color screen that facilitates use in tight spaces. Its intuitive user interface ensures industry-leading ease of use. With wireless sensors and an IP 65 certified design, the ECO is a cost-effective precision device specifically designed for horizontal shaft alignment.
subCats.paragraph_2: Are you confused when the screen doesn’t show the machine from the same angle as your perspective? No problem, we have a solution for that too – Screen Flip. This feature allows you to view the machine setup from your actual vantage point, eliminating any confusion and ensuring accurate alignment.
subCats.paragraph_3: The VertiZontal™ Moves feature shows exactly how much to adjust a misaligned machine by adding or removing shims at its feet. With VertiZontal Moves™, there’s no need to remeasure between vertical and horizontal phases to correct horizontal misalignment. This industry-first function saves time and ensures accuracy on the first attempt.

subCats.name: Lazer Kit
subCats.title: Laser Shaft Alignment
subCats.description: The Laser Kit is designed for affordability without compromising on quality or usability. The system includes two digital smart sensors with 30 mm CCD detectors, providing exceptional alignment precision and repeatability regardless of ambient light conditions. The compact sensor design, only 33 mm thick, allows for easy fitting in even the tightest spaces. The intuitive, text-free graphical user interface ensures ease of use and eliminates language barriers. The software provides real-time guidance throughout the alignment process, with automatic reporting to ensure complete and accurate documentation of all alignment activities. Pre-mounted fixtures and pre-configured setups further enhance the efficiency and ease of use, making the Laser Kit an ideal solution for precise shaft alignment in various industrial applications.
subCats.head_2: Affordable Innovation in Laser Shaft Alignment
paragraph_1: 2 digital smart sensors
2 complete V-brackets
2 chains
Power supply with USB port
Rod tool
Y splitter cable
5 m cable
subCats.paragraph_2: Laser shaft alignment designed and manufactured for mechanics has finally reached a price level accessible to everyone. Traditionally, low cost has meant sacrificing usability, quality, or both—but not this time! The Laser Kit includes two wireless sensor units utilizing line lasers, minimizing setup time and simplifying the installation process. Pre-mounted on fixtures and pre-configured for the most common setup, these sensors ensure ease of use. The software, operable on a tablet or phone, guides users through the entire alignment process with a completely graphical interface, eliminating language barriers. Automatic reporting includes all relevant information, ensuring no doubt about the alignment status and job completion. With a technical platform shared with our most successful and reliable product, the Laser Kit offers all the essential functions expected from an entry-level laser shaft alignment system, ensuring long and trouble-free operation.

subCats.name: Fixturlaser Level
subCats.title: Fixturlaser Level: Precision and Flexibility in Machine Alignment
subCats.description: Fixturlaser Level is a battery-powered measurement sensor that wirelessly connects to the Fixturlaser NXA display unit via Bluetooth. Designed to level machines or machine parts during installation, it provides accurate measurement results with a wide measurement range (± 50 mm/m) and high precision, measuring angular deviations from the surface with a resolution of up to 0.01 mm/m. The measurement sensors can be mounted using magnetic feet or directly onto a table, offering maximum flexibility.
subCats.paragraph_1: The Fixturlaser Level sensor boasts dual-axis capabilities, a wide measurement range (± 50 mm/m), and wireless communication, ensuring precise and efficient alignment processes. With built-in rechargeable batteries and IP65 protection, the sensor is robust and reliable for various industrial environments. Easy to mount and capable of up to 12 hours of continuous operation, it meets the demands of modern machine alignment tasks. The kit includes everything you need for setup and operation, from the Fixturlaser L1 sensor to mounting kits and power cables.
subCats.paragraph_2: The Fixturlaser Level's intuitive design makes it accessible for users of all skill levels. The included components, such as the mounting kit, power cables, and USB connections, ensure a smooth and hassle-free setup. Whether using magnetic feet or direct table mounting, the sensor provides flexibility and ease of use. For more information about the product catalog and pricing, or to schedule a free demo to explore its capabilities and applications, please contact us. We are committed to providing a user-friendly experience and ensuring precision in all your alignment needs.

subCats.name: Acoem SMC EX
subCats.title: Acoem SMC: Advanced Machine Diagnostics and Alignment
subCats.description: The Acoem SMC provides rapid and precise machine diagnostics and alignment through advanced technologies. With features like the Accurex™ automatic machine diagnosis, integrated stroboscope, internal camera, three-axis wireless sensor, and laser pyrometer, the Acoem SMC ensures comprehensive and accurate machine evaluations. Designed for ease of use with a limited lifetime warranty, it is an essential tool for maintaining optimal machine performance.
subCats.head_1: Three Simple Steps for Fast and Accurate Machine Diagnosis
subCats.head_5: Three-Axis Wireless Sensor for Comprehensive Measurements
paragraph_1: Select Your Machine: Start by choosing the machine you wish to diagnose from the device's menu.
Perform Inspections: The system automatically inspects each predefined point on the machine.
Review Diagnostic Report: Access the machine diagnosis report to identify problems and necessary corrective actions.
subCats.paragraph_2: The Acoem SMC is equipped with the innovative Accurex™ automated machine diagnosis, which is seamlessly integrated into the system. This feature provides extensive, reliable diagnostic results, setting the Acoem SMC apart from other systems. Accurex™ ensures that users receive precise and actionable insights into their machine's condition, enhancing overall maintenance effectiveness.
subCats.paragraph_3: The system includes an integrated stroboscope, crucial for accurate RPM measurement. This built-in feature allows for precise determination of RPM values, which is essential for accurate diagnostics and effective machine assessment. The stroboscope enhances the reliability of the diagnostic results by providing accurate RPM data.
subCats.paragraph_4: Featuring an internal camera, the Acoem SMC simplifies machine identification, sensor placement, and report viewing. This clear visual aid streamlines the setup process and improves diagnostic accuracy, allowing users to efficiently manage and interpret machine data with minimal effort.
subCats.paragraph_5: The Acoem SMC’s three-axis wireless sensor provides measurements in vertical, horizontal, and axial planes. This simultaneous measurement capability ensures a thorough evaluation of machine alignment, offering a fast and efficient diagnostic process. The wireless functionality adds flexibility and convenience, enhancing the overall user experience.

subCats.name: PAT
subCats.title: PAT Laser Alignment System: Precision and Ease in Machine Alignment
subCats.description: The PAT Laser Alignment System provides precise machine alignment using two visible laser emitters, each equipped with spring-loaded guides that fit pulley grooves. The system simplifies alignment by allowing operators to instantly see parallel offsets, angular errors, and distortions. With easy installation and versatile mounting options, PAT ensures that machine alignment processes are quick and accurate.
subCats.head_1: Visible Laser Line with Dual Emitters
subCats.paragraph_1: The PAT Laser Alignment System features two laser emitters, each equipped with spring-loaded guides that align with pulley grooves. The use of integrated targets on these lasers makes it straightforward to determine the necessary alignment. Operators can quickly identify parallel offsets, angular errors, and distortions, determining within minutes whether machine alignment is required.
subCats.paragraph_2: The PAT units are designed for easy mounting on pulleys. The spring movement centers the belt groove, and built-in industrial magnets ensure a secure fit on the pulley. The PAT system includes guides for standard pulley sizes A-E (6 mm – 40 mm) and additional guides are available as accessories for timing belt alignment.
subCats.paragraph_3: The visible red laser line helps in pinpointing the location of misaligned machines. The alignment process is straightforward: simply power on the lasers and observe the line on the mounted unit. Adjust the machine’s position until it aligns with the center mark on both units, as shown in the provided diagram.
subCats.paragraph_4: With PAT, detecting alignment issues becomes effortless. The system's laser emitters provide a clear visual reference, enabling operators to spot parallel misalignments, angular deviations, and bends instantly. This immediate feedback allows for quick adjustments, ensuring that the machine is correctly aligned in a matter of minutes.
subCats.paragraph_5: The PAT Laser Alignment System is designed for versatility and ease of use. It accommodates various pulley sizes and types, and its intuitive setup process requires minimal training. Whether dealing with standard or custom applications, PAT provides reliable alignment solutions with user-friendly features.

subCats.name: NXA Geometry
subCats.title: GuideU - Adaptive Graphical User Interface
subCats.description: Acoem’s laser-based geometry systems are distinguished by their industry-leading adaptive graphical user interface, designed for ease of use. Whether used regularly or only a few times a year, our products are developed to be as user-friendly as possible, valuing your time and ensuring efficiency. GuideU's interface accompanies you throughout the entire measurement, adjustment, or alignment process, providing real-time guidance and eliminating the need for second-guessing.
subCats.paragraph_1: The NXA Geometry software provides standard accuracy for measurements, supporting applications for both full and half diameters during measurements, and enabling rectangular and circular alignment measurements for foundations and machine beds during installations. It comes in two versions: NXA Geometry Basic and NXA Geometry Full, with the latter including an additional RS sensor unit for enhanced measurement capabilities. The optional R2 sensor unit, used as a reference detector during measurements, features a 2-axis 20 mm PSD detector, slim design, rechargeable Li-Ion batteries, integrated target and directional coordinates, high-precision inclinometer, instant battery check in both open and closed modes, and integrated Bluetooth for wireless connection between the display unit and smart sensor.
subCats.paragraph_2: Choose from four different laser transmitters for alignment and/or alignment measurements. The Laser Transmitter T110 is suitable for alignment applications with a rigid design for measurement stability, offering up to 50 m laser distance and features micrometer screws for horizontal and vertical adjustments, and is battery-operated. The Laser Transmitter T111, similar to the T110, operates with an AC adapter. For flatness, squareness, and parallelism applications, the Laser Transmitter T21 offers up to 20 m measurement distance with manual adjustment for the laser turret and is battery-operated. The Laser Transmitter T220 is ideal for the same applications, with a robust design for high measurement stability, offering up to 50 m measurement distance, micrometer screws for precise adjustments, built-in levels for laser transmitter adjustment, and is battery-operated.
subCats.paragraph_3: The NXA Geometry Full R2 package includes a display unit, 2 R2 sensors, 2 R2 receiver holders, 2 rotary magnets for sensor holders, a 5m tape measure, 2 angled universal tools, 2 power cables with power supply, a 2 USB port power supply with adapter plugs and an A-micro B USB cable, a USB memory stick, and both the NXA User Manual and NXA Geometry User Manual. The NXA Geometry Basic R2 package includes a display unit, an R2 sensor, an R2 sensor holder, a rotary magnet base for the sensor holder, a 5m tape measure, 2 angled universal tools, 2 power cables with power supply, a 2 USB port power supply with adapter plugs and an A-micro B USB cable, a USB memory stick, and the NXA User Manual and NXA Geometry User Manual.

subItems.name: Ultrasonic Analyzers
subItems.title: Maximize Equipment Reliability with Advanced Ultrasonic Analyzers
subItems.description: Ultrasonic analyzers provide precise and efficient detection of mechanical issues and leaks by capturing high-frequency sound waves beyond human hearing. These tools enable early fault detection, helping to prevent equipment failures and reduce maintenance costs. Ideal for a range of industrial applications, ultrasonic analyzers offer real-time monitoring and detailed analysis to ensure the optimal performance and longevity of your machinery.

subCats.name: FLIR Si124-LD
subCats.title: Revolutionize Leak Detection with the FLIR Si124-LD Acoustic Imaging Camera
subCats.description: The FLIR Si124-LD Acoustic Imaging Camera enables the detection of pressurized air leaks up to 10 times faster than traditional methods. Equipped with 124 microphones, this lightweight, handheld device visually displays ultrasonic information, even in noisy industrial environments, allowing for precise leak localization. It seamlessly integrates with FLIR Thermal Studio for advanced offline analysis and reporting, while also offering cloud-based field analysis via FLIR Acoustic Camera Viewer.
subCats.paragraph_1: The FLIR Si124-LD utilizes advanced acoustic imaging technology to detect pressurized air leaks up to 10 times faster than traditional methods. By employing a sophisticated array of 124 microphones, it captures and visualizes high-frequency ultrasonic waves to pinpoint leaks with exceptional precision. The real-time visual representation of these ultrasonic signals, even in noisy industrial environments, allows for quick and accurate leak localization, enabling maintenance teams to address problems before they escalate and cause significant damage.
subCats.paragraph_2: Optimize the performance of your pneumatic systems with the FLIR Si124-LD to drive down operational costs, minimize equipment failures, and reduce downtime. Its ergonomic, one-handed design ensures ease of use, allowing for efficient scanning and analysis of pressurized systems. The ability to detect leaks early not only helps in avoiding costly repairs but also contributes to energy savings and extends the lifespan of your equipment. Integrating this camera into your maintenance routine can lead to substantial cost savings and improved operational efficiency, making it a valuable asset for any industrial facility.

subCats.name: FLIR Si124-PD
subCats.title: Accelerate Partial Discharge Detection with the FLIR Si124-PD Acoustic Imaging Camera
subCats.description: The FLIR Si124-PD Acoustic Imaging Camera offers up to 10 times faster detection of partial discharges in high-voltage electrical systems compared to traditional methods. Featuring 124 microphones, this lightweight, handheld camera provides precise ultrasonic imaging, even in noisy industrial environments. It delivers real-time acoustic visuals overlayed on digital camera images for accurate localization of discharge sources. The camera integrates with FLIR Thermal Studio for advanced offline editing and reporting, and supports cloud-based field analysis via FLIR Acoustic Camera Viewer, making it an essential tool for maintaining electrical system efficiency and reducing operational costs.
subCats.paragraph_1: With the FLIR Si124-PD, detect partial discharges in high-voltage electrical systems up to 10 times faster than conventional techniques. Its advanced acoustic imaging technology, powered by 124 microphones, provides clear and precise ultrasonic visuals that allow for rapid and accurate identification of electrical discharge sources, even in challenging industrial environments.
subCats.paragraph_2: Enhance your maintenance routine with the FLIR Si124-PD to minimize equipment failures and downtime. By providing real-time classification of partial discharges, this easy-to-use, one-handed camera helps ensure that electrical systems operate efficiently, ultimately leading to cost savings and improved reliability of your high-voltage equipment. Integrate with FLIR Thermal Studio and FLIR Acoustic Camera Viewer for comprehensive analysis and reporting, further supporting efficient maintenance practices.

subCats.name: FLIR Si124
subCats.title: Efficient Leak and Partial Discharge Detection with the FLIR Si124 Acoustic Imaging Camera
subCats.description: The FLIR Si124 Acoustic Imaging Camera is designed to detect pressurized air leaks and partial discharges in high-voltage electrical systems with remarkable speed, up to 10 times faster than traditional methods. This lightweight, one-handed solution utilizes 124 microphones to provide precise ultrasonic imaging, even in noisy environments. Real-time acoustic visuals are overlaid on digital camera images for accurate source localization. The FLIR Acoustic Camera Viewer enables cloud-based field analysis and automatic storage of captured images, facilitating in-depth analysis and issue classification. Regular use of the Si124 can help facilities reduce electricity costs and delay the need for new compressor installations.
subCats.paragraph_1: Detect pressurized air leaks, partial discharges, and electrical discharges up to 10 times faster than traditional methods with the FLIR Si124. This advanced acoustic imaging technology, featuring 124 microphones, offers rapid and precise identification of issues, even in noisy industrial settings.
subCats.paragraph_2: Minimize operational costs, equipment failures, and downtime by accurately detecting and classifying partial discharges or electrical discharges with the FLIR Si124. This easy-to-use, one-handed camera helps maintain optimal pneumatic pressure and electrical system performance, contributing to significant cost savings and improved reliability.

subCats.name: Ultraprobe 15.000
subCats.title: Comprehensive Condition Monitoring with the Ultraprobe 15,000
subCats.description: The Ultraprobe 15,000 offers a powerful, all-in-one solution for detecting leaks and performing condition monitoring across industrial facilities. Featuring touch screen technology and an integrated spectrum analyzer, this device allows for easy on-site data collection, analysis, and reporting. Capture temperature readings, photos, and sound recordings with a single touch, while the built-in infrared thermometer and strobe light enable accurate measurements and RPM recording. Ideal for ultrasonic applications, the Ultraprobe 15,000 includes free licensed software for data management and spectral analysis, making it a top choice for managing critical equipment and ensuring operational efficiency.
subCats.head_5: Built to Last, Designed for Convenience
paragraph_1: User-friendly touchscreen interface
Easy navigation and quick access
Durable and easy-to-clean surface
Digital technology for fast operations
One-touch data access
paragraph_2: Multiple data displays (dB, temperature, spectrum analysis)

Review and storage of historical data
paragraph_3: Infrared thermometer for accurate temperature readings
Emissivity adjustment for precise measurements
Seamless integration with device functions
Immediate temperature data on the screen
Reliable data for monitoring and reporting
subCats.paragraph_4: With the Ultraprobe 15,000, you can trust that the data you collect is accurate and reliable. The device’s integrated data management system ensures that all recorded information is securely stored and easily accessible. This allows for informed decision-making, helping maintenance teams address potential issues before they escalate into major problems.
subCats.paragraph_5: Durability and ease of use are at the core of the Ultraprobe 15,000’s design. The robust construction ensures that the device can withstand the rigors of industrial environments, while the touch screen interface and intuitive controls make it easy to operate. Whether you’re performing routine inspections or in-depth analyses, the Ultraprobe 15,000 is built to deliver consistent performance in any setting.

subCats.description: The Ultraprobe 10,000 revolutionizes ultrasonic inspection with its advanced features, enabling users to conduct condition analysis, record sound, and manage data efficiently. With its versatile applications, from detecting leaks to monitoring electrical systems, this device is a comprehensive solution for all your industrial maintenance needs. Equipped with user-friendly “Press and Listen” technology and robust data management software, the Ultraprobe 10,000 ensures accurate, repeatable results and seamless integration into your maintenance programs. Complete with a full accessory set, it’s designed to meet the most demanding inspection requirements.

Ideal for troubleshooting and preventative maintenance, it allows operators to quickly and easily perform inspections, store data, and manage assets with the Ultratrend DMS™ software. Equipped with unique 'Press and Listen™' technology, it ensures accurate and repeatable digital data, making it perfect for detecting early bearing failures, leaks, and electrical issues.

subCats.name: Ultraprobe 3000
subCats.title: Efficient Detection and Management with Ultraprobe® 3000
subCats.description: The Ultraprobe® 3000 is a versatile digital ultrasonic inspection device designed for precise detection and management of air leaks, gas leaks, steam traps, and electrical issues. With its ergonomic design and advanced data management capabilities, this device helps in reducing energy waste, extending operational uptime, and promoting environmental sustainability.
paragraph_1: Accurately identify and report leaks with cost analysis using DMS software.
Inspect and monitor faulty steam traps for effective maintenance.

subCats.name: Ultraprobe 2000 ATEX
subCats.title: Ultraprobe® 2000ATEX: Comprehensive ATEX-Certified Ultrasonic
subCats.description: The Ultraprobe® 2000ATEX is the most comprehensive ATEX-rated analog ultrasonic device in its sector, offering exceptional flexibility and compatibility across various testing fields. This device excels in leak detection, mechanical inspections, and electrical assessments, providing high performance and reliability in hazardous environments.

subCats.title: Ultraprobe® 2000: The Most Comprehensive Analog Ultrasonic Device
subCats.description: The Ultraprobe® 2000 is designed for fast, accurate, and easy use, allowing proficiency in ultrasonic testing within just 15 minutes. subCats.title: Ultraprobe® 100: Practical Ultrasonic Leak Detection and Diagnostic Device
subCats.description: The Ultraprobe® 100 is a practical, cost-effective tool for leak detection, steam trap inspection, and fault diagnosis. Its ease of use and affordability make it ideal for both beginners and professionals.

subCats.description: The Ultraprobe® 401 Digital Grease Caddy Pro is designed to help you program and optimize your lubrication schedule, reducing bearing failures. Whether you use time-based/preventive lubrication or condition-based lubrication, the Ultraprobe 401 provides all the tools you need.

subCats.name: Ultraprobe 201 Grease Caddy
subCats.title: Ultraprobe® 201 Grease Caddy: Precision Lubrication Monitoring Made Easy
subCats.description: The Ultraprobe® 201 Grease Caddy is a unique, simultaneous lubrication device that allows for ultrasonic monitoring of excessive lubrication. It converts high-frequency sound waves into audible frequencies, helping you listen to bearing conditions and avoid over-lubrication.
paragraph_1: Avoid Over-Lubrication: Monitor and control lubrication levels accurately.
Enhance Equipment Life: Prolong the lifespan of your equipment by preventing over-lubrication.
Detect Bearing Failures: Listen to bearing conditions to identify issues before they become serious.
Reduce Operating Costs: Lower maintenance costs and improve efficiency by optimizing lubrication practices.
paragraph_2: Ultrasonic Monitoring: Converts high-frequency sound waves into audible sounds, making it easy to hear and identify bearing conditions.
LED Display: Visualizes ultrasonic amplitudes on an easy-to-read screen.
